title: Learning Dependency Network
description: An interactive vis-network visualization demonstrating how learning dependencies between concepts can be represented, showing prerequisites flowing to target learning objectives with different node shapes for concept types.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Education
Instructional Design
Learning Dependencies
Concept Mapping
Curriculum Design
learningObjectives: Understand how learning dependencies form a directed graph structure
Analyze prerequisite chains to identify required knowledge
Distinguish between different concept types (foundation, prerequisite, target, advanced)
Apply dependency analysis to plan learning paths

controls.description: Click nodes to highlight all prerequisites
Hover over nodes to see concept definitions

controls.name: Reset View
controls.description: Clear highlighting and return to default view

nodeTypes.name: Foundation
nodeTypes.description: Base concepts that form the starting point of learning

nodeTypes.name: Prerequisite
nodeTypes.description: Required concepts that must be learned before progressing

edgeTypes.name: PREREQUISITE_OF
edgeTypes.description: Points from prerequisite to dependent concept

edgeTypes.name: EXTENDS
edgeTypes.description: Points from concept to advanced application
